results.title: Remembering
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Laura Brearley’s dear friend died of cancer, Brearley took solace in her art, her music and remembering. In doing this, Brearley gave the gift of comfort to many others.

results.title: The Godfather
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Albert Ruddy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s epic masterpiece features Oscar winner Marlon Brando as the patriarch of the Corleone family. Coppola paints a chilling portrait of a Sicilian family’s rise and near fall from power in America, and the passage of rites from father to son. He masterfully balances the story between family life and the ugly business of crime in which they are engaged. Based on Mario Puzo’ best selling novel, this graphic and brilliant film garnered ten Academy Award nominations. Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

results.title: Freely given
results.brief_description: “This instrument may be freely given, never bought or sold” says violin maker John Godschall Johnson as we see him carving and shaping a beautifully handcrafted violin into its final form.

results.title: Rangipukea
results.creator_credit: Vanessa James, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vanessa James talks about the island just off the end of the farm that her family used to own. There they would farm sheep and cattle over the years and throughout the generations.

results.title: Moving to Maldon
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eric and Debra Watson came to Maldon for a long weekend, walked around and fell in love with the town. They saw a church for sale and three days later purchased it and moved from Melbourne. The town felt like home from their first visit and while they feel close enough to the city, their kids have the chance of growing up in a safe country environment where they can walk everywhere and just be kids.

results.title: The Gift
results.creator_credit: Jodine Stodart, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2005, Jodine Stodart travelled to Oxfam Australia to India. It was there that she met a unique lady, not much older than herself, that would leave a lasting impression on the young traveller.

results.title: The Goddess of 1967 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Clara Law, Peter Sainsbury, Eddie L.C. Fong, Still Life Pictures, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: The Goddess of 1967 is a drama from director Clara Law (Floating life) a native of Hong Kong, who lives and works in Australia. Boy (Rikiya Kurokawa) is a Japanese internet hacker and snake enthusiast whose dream car is a 1967 Citroen - the Goddess of the title - which he locates in Australia. When he goes to collect however he discovers the owner dead and he is forced to make a deal with Deirdre (Rose Byrne), the car owner’s blind and emotionally bereft niece. Boy agrees to take Deirdre to her outback hometown (a five day drive) where she plans to confront her estranged and abusive father. This film is saturated in an array of dense colours and images that are overwhelming with their beauty and poignancy. Deirdre’s blind and passionate dancing in a local bar; the burning of an old church; the otherworldliness of the Japanese settings - are all compelling scenes. Both Boy and Deirdre are running from dark pasts (witnessed in a series of flashbacks) but must reconcile their histories in order to move forward individually and as a couple. At times confounding with a desultory narrative, “The Goddess of 1967” ultimately succeeds as a film about family and treachery, revenge and forgiveness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clara Law, Peter Sainsbury, Eddie L.C. Fong, Still Life Pictures, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: Scooter girl
results.creator_credit: Melissa McLachlan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melissa McLachlan considers the advantages of having a scooter to get to work and the social benefits. The scooter is much more than a mode of transport for McLachlan.

results.title: Three cows
results.creator_credit: Gavin Bannerman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gavin Bannerman grew up on a farm out of Brisbane. The Bannermans had a deal with the local butcher for their cattle and every season they would either have a fridge full of meat or a tidy sum. One day, they decided to name their cows.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gavin Bannerman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Newstead Swimming Pool
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Newstead Pool is an important hub of this Victorian town and a community hang-out that gets very lively in the summer. It is run by more than 50 volunteers and is a place for the community to gather and socialise, and has also been known for a sneaky skinny dip.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
